name: Native American Business Development Institute
objective: Under its Native American Business Development Institute (NABDI) conceived in FY 2006, IEED has developed partnerships with U.S. graduate schools to assist tribal business assess financial opportunities and prepare economic feasibility studies. Assistance by way of Public Law 93-638 agreements between tribes and participating business schools. During FY 2006- 2010, NABDI assisted tribes to analyze the potential of economic opportunities as diverse as a business park, a meat packing plant, a wind energy project, a security business, a medical supply business, upland bird hunting, new uses for a dormat tribal wellness/recreation center, and a greenhouse heated by way of woody biomass.  Starting in FY 2011, NABDI funding will be dispersed on a competitive basis following notice in the Federal Register.  Applicants will be free to choose private consultants in addition to graduate schools.

results.description: IA fulfilled its mission objectives by issuing  approximately 20 Self-Determination and Education Assistance Awards in FY 2020
Awards 21 grants to entities to complete the goals and objectives of the program.

authorizations.text: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended, 25 U.S.C. 450.
